channel.title: International CES Attendee News
channel.description: Stay up-to-date on the latest developments for 2008 International CES attendees.

item.title: 2008 CES By the Numbers
item.description: CES reigned again as the world's biggest platform for new technology from the biggest innovators.

item.title: The Eye-Fi Earns Title of Last Gadget Standing
item.description: Wireless memory card that automatically uploads pics from camera to PC wins.

item.title: Technology in Emerging Economies Highlight Day Three of the 2008 International CES
item.description: Inaugural Technology and Emerging Countries Program Featured His Excellency Paul Kagame, President of the Republic of Rwanda and One Laptop Per Child's Nicholas Negroponte.

item.title: Phillips and Motorola Take Home Top Honors in CNET Best of CES
item.description: Awards recognize the best new products at the 2008 show in 10 categories.

item.title: What to Do, Where to Go at CES: Closing Day
item.description: Take time to explore the CES venues beyond the main Las Vegas Convention Center halls.

item.title: Best Buy, Circuit City, China-based Gome and Target Execs Discuss International Retail Trends
item.description: Discussion topics include the HD-DVD and Blu-ray competition and the importance of free trade.

item.title: FCC Chairman Talks to CES Attendees About Digital Television Transition
item.description: Chairman Martin speaks to CES attendees about the spectrum auction and the one-year countdown to the DTV transition.

item.title: Tuesday CES SuperSessions Draw Impressive Crowds, Cover Major Trends
item.description: Disruptive technologies, CE recycling and international broadband deployment hot SuperSession topics.

item.title: New Content Platforms, Auto Technology Among Hot Topics on Second Day of CES
item.description: Comcast and General Motors keynotes highlight how consumer technology impacts content and automotive industries.

item.title: The National Television Academy Presented 13 Emmy Awards at CES
item.description: Microsoft, AMD, DirecTV and Nintendo Bring Home Emmy's

item.title: Peter Frampton Rocks Out for Gibson at CES
item.description: Frampton plays for CES attendees at 6 p.m. tonight.

item.title: What to Do, Where to Go at CES: Day Three
item.description: BMW races, gaming showcases and the BEST of CES are sure-fire bets for Wednesday, January 9

item.title: Jerry Yang unveils Yahoo! Mobile 3.0
item.description: Chief Yahoo! uses CES to announce easier-to-navigate platform for mobile devices.

item.title: Monday SuperSession Topics Range from Hollywood to Public Policy
item.description: Four SuperSessions cover a wide range of current CE industry issues.

item.title: Cutting-edge Technology and Dynamic Keynotes Highlight Day One of CES
item.description: Leaders from Panasonic and Intel kick off world's largest technology tradeshow.

item.title: Where to Go, What to Do at CES: Day Two
item.description: A few sure-fire bets for CES attendees.

item.title: CE Industry Sales to Jump to 6.1 Percent to $171 Billion In 2008
item.description: DTV, gaming and portable navigation emerge as key drivers for growth.

item.title: Gates Keynote, CES Unveiled and Product Debuts Launch the 2008 International CES
item.description: Bill Gates, chairman of Microsoft Corporation, delivered his eleventh and final keynote address Sunday evening.

item.title: Intel Keynote Address: 4:30 p.m. Monday, January 7, at The Venetian
item.description: Intel CEO Paul Otellini takes center stage for CES Day One Afternoon Keynote.

item.title: Learn How CE Shapes Hollywood Decision Making
item.description: Variety Publisher Charlie Koones talks with Disney, Fox, Paramount and Warner Bros. execs.

item.title: Get the Inside Scoop on the Internet from Chief Yahoo!
item.description: Jerry Yang speaks at first of four Industry Insider sessions.

item.title: Now's the Time to Get in Line for Gates Keynote
item.description: CES attendees gear up for the pre-show keynote address from Microsoft's chairman.

item.title: Register for CES. There's Still Time.
item.description: If you missed the advance registration deadline, don't sweat it.

item.title: CNET Expands CES Coverage with Car Tech Testing Lab
item.description: In addition to broadcasting live from the CNET Stage, CNET will host, for the first time, the Car Tech Testing Lab with a satellite stage in the LVCC North Hall.

item.title: Quick Guides Offer Latest CES Information by Market
item.description: Free guides to gaming, in-vehicle technology, wireless, digital imaging and more available now.

item.title: Qualcomm CEO and President of Rwanda Among Technology and Emerging Countries Panelists
item.description: New session promises a tremendous lineup with international appeal and impact.

item.title: Gome Chairman Wong Kwong Yu Joins Industry Insider Lineup
item.description: Gome chairman joins retail giants to discuss the hottest selling technologies.

item.title: What Las Vegas Hotels Still Have Rooms?
item.description: Availability is limited, but several Vegas properties still have rooms for you.

item.title: CES eBooks Available in 10 Languages
item.description: International attendees get a full rundown of CES events, displays and happenings in their native language.

item.title: Vegas Vendors Offer Discounts
item.description: CES attendees get breaks on shows, spa treatments and more.

item.title: CES Hosts More Partner Programs Than Ever in 2008
item.description: Save $200 on Ultimate Pass if you purhcase before January 2.

item.title: CES hosts The Emmy's, John Lennon Educational Tour Bus and More
item.description: Get ready for special events and awards at CES.

item.title: The Engineer's Guide to CES Now Available
item.description: Editors at Electronic Design compile a list of must-sees at CES.

item.title: Hotel Alert
item.description: Some hotels lower CES rates.

item.title: Green Your CES Travel
item.description: Environmental damage caused by show's carbon output compensated through donations to renewable energy, energy efficiency and reforestation projects.

item.description: Flip through hundreds of sessions online now

item.title: How to See the CES Keynotes
item.description: New seating process for general admission to the Bill Gates keynote.

item.description: Top journalists discuss the amazing array of technology, trends and products.

item.description: This full-service center caters to your every need at CES.

item.description: Tuesday session addresses digital television transition, spectrum, broadband and more.

item.description: New CES program explores technology in emerging economies.

item.title: Breaking News: Innovations Honorees Announced
item.description: A waterproof camcorder, miniature photo frame, a wrist mouse and many more take top honors.

item.title: The World's Coolest Tradeshow Just Became the Greenest
item.description: CES makes history as the largest carbon-neutral trade event ever.

item.description: The ins and outs of CES are revealed in daily posts.

item.title: Two New Speakers Added to International Retail Power Panel
item.description: Topics include recent holiday selling season and the hottest selling technologies.

item.title: Gaming Technologies Expand Presence at the 2008 International CES
item.description: CES’ major gaming exhibitors include Commodore Gaming, Entropia Universe, Red Lion Interactive, Shuttle Computers and War Machine.

item.title: Chief Yahoo! Kicks Off 2008 Industry Insider Series at the Las Vegas Hilton Theater
item.description: Jerry Yang co-founded and leads one of the most influential and ground-breaking Internet navigational sites in history.

item.title: Industry Insider Lineup Just Announced
item.description: New lineup includes Best Buy and Circuit City execs among others.

item.title: Nicholas Negroponte to Deliver Keynote for Technology and Emerging Countries Program at CES
item.description: Founder of the One Laptop Per Child project and the MIT Media Lab slated to speak in January.

item.description: And the nominees are...

item.description: Oh Yoko! Show us the new tour bus!

item.title: Interactive Floor Plans Now Available
item.description: If you want to know every detail of the show floor, then we have the tool for you.

item.description: Content bring consumer technology to life at CES.

item.description: Limited offer includes VIP passes to all keynote addresses.

item.description: CES does not use or endorse housing agencies or bureaus.

item.description: Every person on this planet can and will benefit from the latest CE advances.

The Art of Learning: Conference Program Registration Now Open
item.description: New sessions and speakers make for the most impressive session lineup in CES history.

item.description: $12 million project at McCarran airport underway.

item.title: Comcast CEO Throws His Hat in the 2008 CES Ring
item.description: Brian L. Roberts rounds out impressive keynote lineup.
